Referred to the Committee on Oversight and Accountability, and in addition to the Committee on Ways and Means, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To provide members of the President’s Cabinet an allowance to acquire security equipment and services for the personal residences of such members, and for other purposes.

subsection.text: Chapter 59 of title 5, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 5949 the following new section:
The Director of the United States Secret Service Uniformed Division shall reimburse each eligible Cabinet member for—

paragraph.text: any costs incurred by such eligible Cabinet member for the acquisition or installation of safety and security equipment, including cameras, motion sensors, video recorders, door locks, and lighting, at any personal residence of such eligible Cabinet member; and
any recurring monthly fixed costs incurred by such eligible Cabinet member for—

subparagraph.text: maintaining safety and security equipment at any personal residence of such eligible Cabinet member; and
security monitoring services for any personal residence of such eligible Cabinet member.

paragraph.text: The Director may only reimburse a cost under subsection (a) if—

subparagraph.text: such cost was incurred by an eligible Cabinet member while an eligible Cabinet member; and
such eligible Cabinet member submits an application in accordance with subsection (c).

paragraph.text: The aggregate amount which an individual may be reimbursed under paragraph (1) of subsection (a) may not exceed $10,000.
The amount which the Director may reimburse an eligible Cabinet member under paragraph (2) of subsection (a) may not exceed $150 per month.

subsection.text: Each eligible Cabinet member seeking reimbursement under this section shall submit to the Director an application at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the Director determines appropriate.

paragraph.text: The term Director means the Director of the United States Secret Service Uniformed Division.
The term eligible Cabinet member means—

subparagraph.text: the Secretary of Health and Human Services;
the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development;
the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency; and
the Administrator of the Small Business Administration.

paragraph.header: United States Secret Service Uniformed Divisions
paragraph.text: Term United States Secret Service Uniformed Division has the meaning given that term under section 3056A of title 18.

subsection.text: The table of sections for chapter 59 of title 5, United States Code, is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 5949 the following new item:

section.header: Exclusion of residential security allowance from gross income

subsection.text: Part III of subchapter B of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting after section 139I the following new section:

section.header: Residential security allowance for eligible cabinet members
section.text: In the case of an eligible cabinet member (as defined in section 5949a(d) of title 5, United States Code), gross income does not include any amounts received as a reimbursement issued by the Director of the United States Secret Service Uniformed Division under section 5949a(a) of title 5, United States Code.

subsection.text: The table of sections for part III of subchapter B of chapter 1 of such Code is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 139I the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 139J. Residential security allowance for eligible cabinet members.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to amounts received after the date of the enactment of this Act.
